resources.string: Patch the system against the Fake ID vulnerability (bug 13678484)

This patch fixes the Fake ID vulnerability (bug 13678484). 
 
The bug allows malicious apps to pretend to be signed by trusted providers and be loaded as extensions in several contexts, such as NFC access, browser plugins and others, depending on the device and which extension mechanisms the manufacturer chose to include. 
 
A great explanation of the implications and why the problem occurs can be found on this article by Jeff Forristal from Bluebox. 
 
For any questions, please visit this thread.
This appliction does not have any configurations. It is an Xposed mod that should be enabled on its framework manager to produce effects!
The patch is active. You should be protected from this vulnerability.
Note: The patch is not active! Verify that the Xposed framework is running properly and that this module is enabled. If so, check the Xposed logs for any errors.
